segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over, and he doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, waiting for him to hand her a cookie, as if this is completely normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at their teamwork, even though it’s risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman drying dishes has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’d be angry if she caught them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water from the sink is getting closer to them, and I hope they don’t slip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is like a silent movie—so much tension, but no one’s saying a word.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I should probably say something, but I don’t want to ruin their fun.
segments.speaker: PAR
